newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: MALAYSIA STOCKS - factors to watch - March 6.
newsitem.headline: MALAYSIA STOCKS - factors to watch - March 6.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Malaysian stocks on Thursday:

* On Wednesday, the U.S. Dow Jones Industrial Average jumped 93.13 to 6,945.85 as Fed chairman Alan Greenspan eased investors' concerns by saying the central bank was not out to deflate the stock market by boosting interest rates.
* In Kuala Lumpur, the benchmark Composite Index gained 5.05 points to close at 1,252.28 on a rebound after two days of weakness.
* Stocks of the DRB-Hicom group remain suspended.

* DRB-Hicom to hold news conference on groups' future direction at 1730 (0930 GMT) to discuss its future direction after Monday's death of its late chief Yahaya Ahmad. Company said the news conference will be addressed by group managing director Saleh Sulong.
* Food products firm Nestle announced its 1996 net profit rose 9.1 percent to 176.58 million ringgit.
* Construction products trader Hume Industries reported said its 6-month net profit rose 28 percent to 68.61 million ringgit.
